intro: Urostigma strictum, commonly known as the narrowleaf bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, elongated leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and it produces pods that contain small, round seeds. Urostigma strictum is often found in dry, disturbed soils and is considered a weed in some agricultural settings.
